Subject: Re: [junit] need help with suite.addTest() method
References: <3ADE61E0.CEA2584B@...> <01dc01c0c888$c5cba920$01000001@scooby00>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
From: James Sinnamon <sinnamon@...>

Scott,


Scott Eade wrote:

> James,
>
> If you want to run all of the methods in a class whose name begins with "test"
> you can go:
>
>     suite.addTest(new TestSuite(TestBidsReadyTable.class));
>
> This way you only need one line of code per test class.
>

Thanks for that.  It worked perfectly.  One of these days I may be able to
understand all of this, but in the meantime, it makes my life a lot a easier.

>
> This is the way I do it because we don't have bunches of new test classes
> being created all of the time.
>
> Others may provide a pointer to some code that will search for all class
> names that end in "Test" and construct a test suite from the result.  This
> may be more useful if you live in a more dynamic environment than I do.
>

Its more work than I would like to do right now, but the idea might come in
handy later on.

Thanks again.

regards,

James.

--
James Sinnamon  sinnamon@...

subject: Re: [junit] need help with suite.addTest() method
